Change de position of the sidebar 2. Restart the VSCode 3. Open Welcome screen 4. Click on "Interface overview" Reproduces without extensions: No

data.title: Feature Request: Please add the ability to select multiple files/folders in the explorer view
data.body:
Hi, 

I'd like to ask you to add the ability to select and operate multiple files/folders in the explorer view. 

It is a common practice to select multiple items on a GUI by holding CTRL and clicking the items. Alternatively, one can select consecutive items by clicking the first item and then SHIFT+clicking the last item. But multi-selection is not supported in the VS code explorer view. When working on a large project sometimes it is needed to select multiple files/folders and operate them together, such as opening, deleting, or submitting to VCS, etc.

Without this functionality it could be tedious to operate files. Please consider this. Thank you.

data.title: Fix dangling active terminal on delete
data.body:
Fixes an issue where if you delete a terminal that is not the last one and you also have the active terminal as the last one, the index doesn't get updated and the terminal panel title is blank.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create three terminals and focus the last one
2. Delete the second one through the quick picker
3. Observe that the panel title is blank

data.title: Applying textedits from code actions doesn't automatically adjust tabs automagically
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.15-insiders 9b6cc9f774f424b4e8a91d4a2d3d4ad8efb9cfb9
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a text file using spaces for tabs (doesn't matter how many indented lines there are)
2. Have a code completion response returning tabs for indentation, like:
```[Trace - 3:45:32 PM] Received response 'completionItem/resolve - (316)' in 18ms.
Result: {
    "label": "something() : void",
    "kind": 3,
    "detail": "Override method in 'IFoo'",
    "documentation": " This should be inherited ",
    "sortText": "999998843",
    "filterText": "something",
    "insertText": "something",
    "insertTextFormat": 2,
    "textEdit": {
        "range": {
            "start": {
                "line": 9,
                "character": 4
            },
            "end": {
                "line": 9,
                "character": 5
            }
        },
        "newText": "@Override\npublic void something() {\n\t${0}\n}"
    }
```
Once the text edit applied, the indentation is transformed to use spaces

2. Do the same thing from a code action, like 
```
[Trace - 3:59:58 PM] Received response 'textDocument/codeAction - (436)' in 9ms.
Result: [
    {
        "title": "Add unimplemented methods",
        "command": "java.apply.workspaceEdit",
        "arguments": [
            {
                "changes": {
                    "file:///Users/fbricon/Dev/souk/vertx-game-server/src/main/java/com/redhat/middleware/keynote/discovery/Meh.java": [
                        {
                            "range": {
                                "start": {
                                    "line": 7,
                                    "character": 12
                                },
                                "end": {
                                    "line": 7,
                                    "character": 12
                                }
                            },
                            "newText": "\n\n\t"
                        },
                        {
                            "range": {
                                "start": {
                                    "line": 7,
                                    "character": 12
                                },
                                "end": {
                                    "line": 7,
                                    "character": 12
                                }
                            },
                            "newText": "@Override\n\tpublic void something() {\n\t\t"
                        },
                        {
                            "range": {
                                "start": {
                                    "line": 7,
                                    "character": 12
                                },
                                "end": {
                                    "line": 7,
                                    "character": 12
                                }
                            },
                            "newText": "\n\t}"
                        }
                    ]
                }
            }
        ]
    }
]
```
in that case, the indentations are inserted as tabs, while I expect the automagical conversion to spaces.

I'm not sure if this is caused by the code action returning multiple text edits.

Reproduces without extensions: Maybe.

This can be reproduced by testing https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/pull/322. cc @aeschli

data.title: Visual Code terminal takes too long to abort nodemon with CTRL+C
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->
When you press `CTRL + C` when running `nodemon your-file.js`, Visual Code takes several seconds to show prompt again.

Not sure if this is related to mongodb open connection while running the server. Packages used: 

```
{
...
  "engines": {
    "node": "8.2.1"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "body-parser": "^1.17.2",
    "express": "^4.15.3",
    "lodash": "^4.17.4",
    "mongodb": "^2.2.30",
    "mongoose": "^4.11.5"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "expect": "^1.20.2",
    "mocha": "^3.5.0",
    "nodemon": "^1.11.0",
    "supertest": "^3.0.0"
  }
}

```

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.15063]

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/205577/29091510-97217a4a-7c59-11e7-8111-69336a980db0.png)


Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run `nodemon your-file.js`
2. node app will be running (on a port such as 3000)
3.  click on terminal and press `CTRL+C`
4. Visual Code takes too long to cancel nodemon execution
5. There is no UI info showing if terminal (bash.exe) is processing this cancel request
6. The prompt will be shown after a big delay `youruser@YourPC MINGW64 ~/YourFolder/your-node-rest-api (master)`

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Integrated Terminal won't accept focus
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 ( 1703)

 
I am using vscode ( 1.14.2) for python developement in windows 10 ( 1703)
very often when I  click inside the terminal and press ctrl+C to terminate my program , I realize that the terminal doesn't accept focus. when this happens I can't even copy text from terminal or to scroll to see it's previous content. Atthis point the only solution is to resize the terminal window ( or to resize vscode main window ) . After the restart things go back to normal

data.title: Quick Open View doesn't work consistently

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
On Mac from Command Palette:
1. Open Command Palette, type "Quick Open View"
2. Select by clicking: the quick open view appears
3. Select using enter: the quick open view flashes and then disappears :x:

On Mac from Keybinding:
1. Open "Quick Open View" using Ctrl+Q
2. View disappears when Ctrl key is released :x:
3. Navigation works when holding down Ctrl and pressing Q 
4. Navigation does not work when holding down Ctrl and pressing arrow keys :x:

On Windows:
1. Open Command Palette, type "Quick Open View"
2. Select by clicking: the quick open view appears
3. Select using enter: the quick open view flashes and then disappears :x:
4. Navigation works by pressing arrow keys without holding down Ctrl

data.title: Highlighting for PHP breaks when using a namespaced trait
Mac: click-through from other app should focus on the editor area that was clicked
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:22:50.650Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions:

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
python|don|0.7.0



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Terminal area
2. In Code, click the code area to focus it
3. Switch to another app
4. Click terminal area in Code through another app

The expected behavior for click-through on macOS is that focus goes to the area that you've clicked. For instance, if I have a (standard) Terminal window with two tabs open and the Finder is the foreground program, clicking on a tab on that terminal window will both bring the Terminal app in focus and switch to the tab that I've clicked.

With Code, the actual behavior is that the program goes to the foreground but the focus within the app stays with whatever was focused at the time Code was put to the background.

This frequently causes me to start typing commands in my editor view.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Suggestion: Open debug view automatically when hitting a breakpoint or exception
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a simple hello world program for node js.
2. Add configuration.
3. Go back to file view tab from the debug view tab.
4. Add a breakpoint.
5. F5

Expected:
VSCode switches to debug view when hitting breakpoint - I want to be able to see the callstack pane.

Actual:
VSCode hits breakpoint, but does not show the callstack (still in file view tab).

data.title: Terminal Switcher should move keyboard focus
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (6feff11ed03402cf77e04e74e13c55529fdb4d09, 2017-08-04T17:43:56.658Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0

---
After having used the terminal switcher for a few days, I realize that I'm always assuming that the keyboard focus moves when I change the active terminal, same what happens when using `Open View` from the command pallet. As it doesn't I often end up doing the wrong thing, i.e. type shell commands in the open editor, etc.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open two terminals and one editor
2. Put the keyboard focus in the editor
3. Use `Switch active terminal` to change the visible terminal
4. Start typing
-> the editor content is being modified

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Remove tags that exist in MimeTypes
data.body: Removing tags that we can better get from FilePUT and FileGET - this will reduce the volume of telemetry and also reduce confusion.

data.title: No Intellisense for linked library
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063

---

I am not sure if this is an issue with `TypeScript` or `VSCode`, but I created an `npm link`, and typescript doesn't seem to be able to pick up my typings within the linked library. Following the instructions on npmjs.com I did the following:

```
cd /libs/my-awesome-library
npm link
cd /projects/my-awesome-project
npm link my-awesome-library
```

I have a `tsconfig.json` file, in the root of my project:

```json
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "es6",
    "module": "commonjs",
    "outDir": "app"
  },
  "files": [
    "src/index"
  ]
}
```

I have tried adding: 
```json
  "include": [
    "node_modules/my-awesome-library/typings/**/*.d.ts"
  ],
```

But I still don't get completions for my library. The only completions that I get are the ones defined in the `js`, which suggests almost everything as `any` when they should be `string`, `object`, `number`, etc.

data.title: editor.tokenColorCustomizations not applied on the fly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.15.0-insider (6feff11ed03402cf77e04e74e13c55529fdb4d09, 2017-08-04T17:43:56.658Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.16
quokka-vscode|Wal|1.0.46
crazy|kie|0.0.1
githistory|don|0.2.3
python|don|0.7.0
gitlens|eam|4.3.3
tslint|eg2|0.17.0
vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.2.0
vsc-travis-ci-status|fel|1.1.0
svgpreview|kis|0.2.0
Go|luk|0.6.63
mssql|ms-|1.1.0
github-issues-prs|ms-|0.4.0
debugger-for-chrome|msj|3.1.7
vscode-versionlens|pfl|0.19.1
Ruby|reb|0.13.0
kustovscode|sea|0.0.1
php-syntax-visualizer|vsc|0.0.1
vscode-open-in-github|ziy|1.2.7

(1 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open settings
2. Open a TS file to the side of the settings editor
3. Enable autosave
4. Use the following customization in settings
```json
    "editor.tokenColorCustomizations": {
        "textMateRules": [
            {
                "scope": "keyword",
                "settings": {
                    "fontStyle": "bold"
                }
            },
            {
                "scope": "storage",
                "settings": {
                    "fontStyle": "bold"
                }
            },
            {
                "scope": "constant.language",
                "settings": {
                    "fontStyle": "bold"
                }
            },
            {
                "scope": "support.class.builtin",
                "settings": {
                    "fontStyle": "bold"
                }
            }
        ]
    }
```
5. Restart VS Code (that already shows the issue)
6. Change font style from bold to normal
-> no changes are happening on the fly; need to restart VS Code to apply changes correctly

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Intellisense takes lot of time to load on larger projects
data.body:
1) Language: Javascript (React)
2) Disabling all the extensions doesn't work the problem still persists.
3) It takes usually 5 sec and it happens every time not only first load.
4) The project is 11mb excluding node_modules.
5) It is bit faster when you open only one file at a time, multiple files open slows it down

data.title: Code takes incredibly long for tiny path suggestions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
pgsql|dou|0.0.8
EditorConfig|Edi|0.9.4
JSDocTagComplete|Hoo|0.0.2
vscode-esformatter|how|1.5.2
output-colorizer|IBM|0.1.2
vscode-puglint|mrm|2.3.0
code-spell-checker|str|1.3.5



---

Steps to Reproduce:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1658949/29072766-60e16b76-7c49-11e7-9bc9-9a89dd8ded90.png)

This keeps happening. Code will take forever to complete loading the suggestions, even though there are only 5 or 6 items. When I restart Code, it works instantly for a couple of minutes. Then it gets stuck on "Loading..." again.
